result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:30 AM Defendant Michael Andrew Wales in court.  Attorney Jason D Sanders in court for Michael Andrew Wales.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1. Count 2 is dismissed and read in. Court orders presentence investigation. Bond continued. 
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 9:15 AM.
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.

8:46 AM Defendant Michael Andrew Wales in court.  Attorney Jason D Sanders in court for Michael Andrew Wales.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:15 am.
Calendar call on September 22, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.B.T., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. If released curfew between 6pm-6am unless at work or traveling to and from work, or at counseling or traveling to and from counseling.

2:50 PM Defendant Michael Andrew Wales in court by video with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily, rights given.  Court binds Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to defendant, reading waived. Not Guilty Plea entered by defendant.  Jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
